info.title: Nrf_Rating
info.description:
## RF Rating Service
The RF performs both monetary and non-monetary unit determination (rating) for all charging levels (bearer, session and service) before and after service delivery (prepaid and postpaid) and based on dynamic credit limit update. Rating considers cross-product, cross-channel, counter-based, rental-based and recharge-based discounts, benefits and allowances. Rating may be performed based on dimensions of volume, time and events.

Rate requests include various rating parameters such as service identifier, subscriber reference, network identification, user location, service usage time, transferred data volume, etc. The rate request may contain multiple service identifiers that reflect the list of active services contained in the context handled by the rating service consumer (CHF/OCF).

The RF determines the applicable price or tariff model and returns it to the NF consumer (CHF/OCF), according to rate requests, subscriber contractual terms, the rating rules configured by operators and billing related information. Note that in case of multiple service requests received, the RF may apply a special price or tariff which can be different to the price or tariff applied to the related services handled separately. For example a VoLTE call may have the data volume associated with the bearer usage free of charge while rating the time associated with the voice session.

To support the online rating process, the RF needs counters. The counters may be maintained by the RF or by the ABMF. In the former case counters are optional in rating requests.

See\:
  - [3GPP TS 32.296 Online Charging System (OCS) - Applications and Interfaces](https://www.3gpp.org/ftp/Specs/archive/32_series/32.296)
  - [3GPP TS 32.290 Services, Operations and Procedures of Charging using Service Based Interface (SBI)](https://webapp.etsi.org/key/key.asp?GSMSpecPart1=32&GSMSpecPart2=290)
  - [3GPP TS 32.291 5G System, Charging Service; Stage 3](https://webapp.etsi.org/key/key.asp?GSMSpecPart1=32&GSMSpecPart2=291)

apiRoot.description: apiRoot as defined in subclause 4.4 of 3GPP TS 29.501.

IEC (Class B).description: Request an atomic charging operation which succeeds or fails.

ECUR (Class A).summary: Event Charging with Unit Reservation (ECUR) (Class A)
ECUR (Class A).description: Request a traiff rate for a one time event.

ECUR (Class B).summary: Event Charging with Unit Reservation (ECUR) (Class B)
ECUR (Class B).description: Request a reservation for a one time event.

SCUR (Class A).summary: Session Charging with Unit Reservation (SCUR) (Class A)
SCUR (Class A).description: Request a tariff rate for charging a session. Two services are requested (i.e. data and VoLTE).

SCUR (Class B).summary: Session Charging with Unit Reservation (SCUR) (Class B)
SCUR (Class B).description: Request a reservation for charging a session. Two services are requested (i.e. data and VoLTE).

Roaming.description: Request a reservation for charging a roaming voice call session. The serving VLR number is provided to enable rating based on Visited PLMN.

ECUR (Class A).summary: Event Charging with Unit Reservation (ECUR) (Class A)

SCUR (Class A).summary: Session Charging with Unit Reservation (SCUR) (Class A)
SCUR (Class A).description: Successful tariff rating for a data session. Rate to apply is 0.75 PHP per megabyte.

ECUR (Class B).summary: Event Charging with Unit Reservation (ECUR) (Class B)

SCUR (Class B).summary: Session Charging with Unit Reservation (SCUR) (Class B)
SCUR (Class B).description: Successful reservation for a data session. Two services were requested and both were granted.

PARTIAL.description: Reservation request succeeds for one service but is unsuccessful for another. The session may continue with the service which succeeded.

error.title: Request denied due to insufficient credit

UNKNOWN_CONTEXT.description: The request failed completely due to an unknown service context value.

value.title: Incomplete or erroneous session or subscriber information

QUOTA_LIMIT_REACHED.description: The request failed completely due to insuffcient credit to fulfill the reservation request.

value.title: Request denied due to insufficient credit (usage applied)

USER_UNKNOWN.description: The request failed completely because the subscriber identity could not be matched with a known subscriber.

value.title: Request denied because the subscriber identity is unrecognized

post.summary: Create rating data for a new event or session
post.description: The rating data collection represents instances of rating requests.

SCUR (Class B).summary: Session Charging with Unit Reservation (SCUR) (Class B)

parameters.name: RatingDataRef
parameters.description: A unique identifier for a rating data resource.

200.description: Updated Rating Data resource is returned

SCUR (Class B).summary: Session Charging with Unit Reservation (SCUR) (Class B)

post.summary: In session interim rating data update.
post.description: Provides an interim update for on going session.  May contain reservation requests and/or reports of used units.

ECUR (Class B).summary: Event Charging with Unit Reservation (ECUR) (Class B)

SCUR (Class B).summary: Session Charging with Unit Reservation (SCUR) (Class B)

parameters.name: RatingDataRef
parameters.description: A unique identifier for a rating data resource.

SCUR (Class B).summary: Session Charging with Unit Reservation (SCUR) (Class B)

post.summary: End of session rating data update.
post.description: Indicates the end of an existing session.  May contain  reports of used units.

nfConsumerIdentification.description: Contains a set of information identifying the network function (NF) consumer of the rating service.

invocationTimeStamp.description: The time at which the request is sent.

beginTimeStamp.description: The time of the service activation request.

invocationSequenceNumber.description: The sequence number of the rating service invocation by the network function (NF) consumer.

oneTimeEvent.description: Indicates, if included, that this is event based rating and whether this is a one-time event. If true, this is a one-time event, that there will be no update or release.

oneTimeEventType.description: Indicates the type of the one time event, i.e. Immediate or post event rating.

serviceRating.description: One or more service elements to be rated.

invocationTimeStamp.description: The time at which the response is sent.

invocationSequenceNumber.description: The sequence number of the rating service invocation by the network function (NF) consumer.

invocationResult.description: Holds the result of rating service invocation by the network function (NF) consumer.

serviceRating.description: One or more rated service elements.

serviceId.description: Identifies the service for which the rating request was sent. This ID with the serviceContextId together forms a unique identification of the service.

ratingGroup.description: Identifies the charging key for the service.

originationId.description: Identifies the origination(s), from which the requested service is directed.

destinationId.description: Identifies the destination(s), to which the requested service is directed.

serviceInformation.description: The structure of serviceInformation is defined in the "middle-tier" documents and formally specified in TS 32.299. The content of this parameter corresponds to the service indicated by serviceContextId.

userInformation.description: Information about the user and user equipment.

basicPriceTimeStamp.description: The timestamp of the last rating of the Basic Price, if applicable for the service indicated by the serviceId.

requestedUnit.description: The number of requested units from the service.

consumedUnit.description: The number of consumed units of the service.

consumedUnitAfterTariffSwitch.description: The number of consumed units of the service since previous request after tariff switch occurred. This parameter is mandatory if the tariff switch occurred since the previous request.

serviceId.description: Identifies the service for which the rating request was sent. This ID with the serviceContextId together forms a unique identification of the service.

ratingGroup.description: Identifies the charging key for the service.

grantedUnit.description: The number of granted units for the service.

basicPrice.description: Contains a basic fee, that is applicable (e.g. only once per day). If the basicPrice is received by an NF consumer, the NF will deduct this price from the subscriber's account balance, and it will store the current system time internally as timestamp for the last charging of the basic price.

counterPrice.description: Contains information on how the NF consumer shall modify a specified counter of the subscriber in the ABMF.

impactOnCounter.description: Contains information on how the counter has been modified as a result of the current online session. It is used by the CDF for inclusion in the CDRs.

tariffSwitchTime.description: Time period in seconds from the time included in beginTimeStamp of the request until the next tariff switch occurs. A value "0" means, that the tariff switch occurs immediately, i.e. the tariff information contained in nextMonetaryTariff is valid immediately.

nextTariff.description: Tariff after the next tariff switch.

expiryTime.description: Time period in seconds from the time in beginTimeStamp of the request until the expiration of all tariff information contained in this response message. This attribute may be used e.g. if multiple tariff switches are foreseen, or if interworking between limited valid units and tariff switches needs to be ensured.

validUnits.description: Defines for how many units the tariff is valid.

tariffAfterValidUnits.description: Tariff after all valid units have been used. This attribute may be used to optimize service availability in scenarios with limited valid units.

requestedCounter.description: One or multiple CounterIDs. Only the counters identified in this list shall be included by the NF consumer in subsequent update requests within this session. The list is valid until a modified list is received by the NF or until the session ends.

ServiceContextId.description:
A unique identifier of the service specific document that applies to the request. This is an identifier allocated by the service provider/operator, by the service element manufacturer or by a standardization body and MUST uniquely identify a given service specific document. For offline charging, this identifies the service specific document ("middle tier" TS) on which associated CDRs should based.
The format of the Service-Context-Id is':'
[extensions.MNC.MCC.Release.]<service-context>@domain
The 3GPP specific values for <service-context@domain include':'
  32251@3gpp.org for PS charging
  32260@3gpp.org for IMS charging
  32274@3gpp.org for SMS service charging
  32275@3gpp.org for MMTel service charging
  32276@3gpp.org for VCS charging

ServiceInformation.description: This parameter holds the individual service specific parameters as defined in the corresponding "middle tier" 3GPP TS.

ratType.description: Indicates which Radio Access Technology is currently serving the UE.

smsNode.description: Identifies the role which the SMS node performs in relation to the charging event.

messageType.description: Indicates the type of the message which caused the charging interaction.

serviceType.description: Indicates the type of SM service that caused the charging interaction (3GPP TS 22.142). Present if 'messageType' is 'SM Service Request'.

enum: VAS4SMS Short Message Forwarding multiple subscriptions
VAS4SMS Short Message to multiple destinations
VAS4SMS Short Message Virtual Private Network (VPN)

smsResult.description: Result of an attempt for an SM transaction (submission or delivery).

mmContentType.description: Indicates the overall content type of the MM content and includes information about all the contents of an MM.

contentClass.description: Classifies the content of the MM to the highest content class to which the MM belongs (OMA MMS Encapsulation Protocol).

messageType.description: Type of the message according to the MMS transactions (e.g. submission, delivery).

messageSize.description: Total size in bytes of the MM (3GPP TS 23.140)

vasId.description: Identification of a Value Added Service (VAS).

startTime.description: The start time at the MSC.

startOfCharging.description: Contains the time origin for charging and may be equivalent to the time call setup is initiated or the time the call is answered depending on configuration. It is only sent if call setup was successful.

stopTime.description: Contains the time when the call wass released.

isupCause.description: Indicates the reason the call was released.

causeValue.description: Identifies the reason a voice call service is released. See 3GPP TS 29.078 for supported values.

causeLocation.description: Identifies identifies the network in which the event caused the voice call service release.

causeDiagnostics.description: Holds the diagnostics field associated with the release of the voice call service, if available. See 3GPP TS 29.078 for supported values.

callReferenceNumber.description: The network call reference number assigned to the call by the GMSC/MSC.

mscAddress.description: The international E.164 number of the serving Mobile Switching Center (MSC).

locationNumber.description: The E.164 location number for the served user transported in ISUP.

vlrNumber.description: The international E.164 number of the serving Visitor Location Register (VLR).

counterId.description: Used to address a specific counter, i.e. it identifies the counter. Therefore, the counterID shall be unique for each subscriber.

counterType.description: An operator specific value which characterizes the counter. Used only for descriptive purposes. In contrast to the counterID, the counterType may be not unique.

counterChangePerSession.description: The value, with which the counter shall be incremented or decremented once for the whole online charging session.

counterChangePerConsumedServiceUnit.description: The value, with which the counter shall be incremented or decremented per consumed service unit.

counterChangeForFirstChargeableTimeUnit.description: The value, with which the counter shall be incremented or decremented for the first chargeable time unit. The first chargeable time unit is defined by unitType in rateElement of monetaryTariff.

counterChangePerSubsequentChargeableTime.description: The value, with which the counter shall be incremented or decremented per chargeable time unit, except for the first chargeable time unit. The subsequent chargeable time unit is defined by unitType in rateElement of currentTariff.

counterChangePerChargeableVolumeUnit.description: The value, with which the counter shall be incremented or decremented per chargeable volume unit.  The chargeable volume unit is defined by unitType in rateElement of currentTariff.

counterChangeForFirstChargeableTimeUnitA.description: The value, with which the counter shall be incremented or decremented for the first chargeable time unit, if a tariff switch has occurred immediately at the beginning of the online charging session. The first chargeable time unit is defined by unitType in rateElement of nextTariff.

counterChangePerSubsequentChargeableTime.description: The value, with which the counter shall be incremented or decremented per chargeable time unit (except for the first chargeable time unit), after a tariff switch has occurred. The chargeable time unit is defined by unitType in rateElement of a nextTariff.

counterChangePerChargeableVolumeUnitAfte.description: The value, with which the counter shall be incremented or decremented per chargeable volume unit after a tariff switch has occurred.  The chargeable volume unit is defined by unitType in rateElement of a nextTariff.

counterThreshold.description: A threshold value for the counter. If the value of the specified counter reaches this threshold value, all tariff information contained in the request expires, and the NF consumer shall send a new request to the RF.

setCounterTo.description: The value, to which the counter shall be set (e.g. to reset counters).

counterExpiryDate.description: The timestamp, at which the current value of the counter expires.

counterId.description: Used to address a specific counter, i.e. it identifies the counter. Therefore, the counterID shall be unique for each subscriber.

counterValueBegin.description: The value for the counter at the beginning of the current online changing session.

counterValueChange.description: Contains the change of the value for the counter as result of the current online charging session.

counterValueEnd.description: Contains the change of the value for the counter at the end of the current online charging session.

time.description: This field holds the amount of requested time.

totalVolume.description: This field holds the amount of requested volume in both uplink and downlink directions.

uplinkVolume.description: This field holds the amount of requested volume in uplink direction.

downlinkVolume.description: This field holds the amount of requested volume in downlink direction.

serviceSpecificUnit.description: This field holds the amount of requested service specific units.

time.description: This field holds the amount of granted time.

totalVolume.description: This field holds the amount of granted volume in both uplink and downlink directions.

uplinkVolume.description: This field holds the amount of granted volume in uplink direction.

downlinkVolume.description: This field holds the amount of granted volume in downlink direction.

serviceSpecificUnit.description: This field holds the amount of granted service specific units.

time.description: This field holds the amount of consumed time.

totalVolume.description: This field holds the amount of consumed volume in both uplink and downlink directions.

uplinkVolume.description: This field holds the amount of consumed volume in uplink direction.

downlinkVolume.description: This field holds the amount of consumed volume in downlink direction.

serviceSpecificUnit.description: This field holds the amount of consumed service specific units.

Price.description: The price for a rated service.

amount.description: The price amount for the rated service.

Tariff.description: Set of parameters defining the network utilization charges for the use of a particular bearer/session/service.

CurrencyCode.description: A currency code that specifies in which currency the values of monetary units were given.  It is specified by using the values defined in the ISO [4217](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html) standard.

UnitValue.description: Specifies a floating-point value. The UnitValue is a significand with an exponent; i.e., UnitValue = valueDigits * 10^exponent. This representation avoids unwanted rounding off. For example, the value of 2.3 is represented as ValueDigits = 23 and Exponent = -1. The absence of the exponent part MUST be interpreted as an exponent equal to zero.

valueDigits.description: The significand of the floating point value.

exponent.description: The exponent of the floating point value

RateElement.description: Holds a simple rate element of one dimension. In example when unitType=TIME, UnitValue.valueDigits=6, unitCost.valueDigits=10, unitCost.exponent=2 it may be read as "10 cents per 6 seconds time". The currency is context dependent.

chargeReasonCode.description: Identifies if the rate element corresponds to a specific charge type.

unitQuotaThreshold.description: Denotes the durability of a rating element within a Tariff. i.e. if the service consumed unitQuotaThreshold number of unitTypes, the next rating element becomes in effect.
